common_errors.cause: Symbol is used but not defined in any linked object file or library
common_errors.solution: Link with library containing symbol: -l<lib>. Check symbol exists: nm -C lib.a | grep symbol

common_errors.cause: Linker cannot find specified library in search path
common_errors.solution: Add library path with -L/path. Install library. Check lib name (lib<name>.so/.a)

common_errors.cause: Same symbol defined in multiple object files/libraries
common_errors.solution: Remove duplicate definitions. Use 'static' for internal linkage. Check for duplicate .o files.

common_errors.cause: Cannot write to output location (permissions, directory doesn't exist)
common_errors.solution: Check output directory exists and is writable. Check disk space.

common_errors.cause: Code/data too far apart for relocation type (often 32-bit overflow on 64-bit)
common_errors.solution: Use -mcmodel=large for large code. Try -fPIC for shared libraries. Reduce code size.

common_errors.cause: Indirect dependency not specified on link line (transitive dependency)
common_errors.solution: Add missing library to link command. Order matters: dependent libs after dependencies.

common_errors.cause: Invalid linker flag or flag not supported by this linker
common_errors.solution: Check ld --help or man ld. Flags differ between GNU ld, gold, lld, macOS ld.

common_errors.cause: Library architecture doesn't match target (32-bit vs 64-bit, ARM vs x86)
common_errors.solution: Use correct library version for target arch. Check with: file lib.so

common_errors.cause: Symbol version required by object not provided by library (ABI incompatibility)
common_errors.solution: Update library to matching version. Rebuild dependent code against current library.

common_errors.cause: Thread-local storage model mismatch between compilation units
common_errors.solution: Use consistent TLS model: -ftls-model=global-dynamic (or local-dynamic, initial-exec)
